reasoning: Good move adding a load balancer—it improves scalability and availability, which is critical for modern web apps. I’d position it above 'frontend', so users hit the load balancer first before reaching frontend components—this better represents real deployment architectures where requests route through multiple layers. Additionally, to emphasize this hierarchy visually, I would draw an arrow from the load balancer pointing down towards the frontend rectangle. This clarifies that all user-initiated HTTP/HTTPS traffic passes through the load balancer before hitting any internal component.
